result.execSummary:
The defendant Turner Douglas Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay $200.00 fine plus costs for a total owing of $705.00.

Defendant to pay restitution and 10% surcharge in an amount to be determined.  State to provide amount within 30 days of sentence to Attorney Aldinger Hamblin.  Upon notification, Attorney Aldinger Hamblin has 30 days to request a restitution hearing.
Defendant to obtain/maintain full time school or employment or combination of both equivalent to full time.
Defendant may apply to the Court for expungement after 18 months from sentence date if he successfully completes probation and has no new charges.

Defendant to undergo anger management assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with any conditions, assessments and no contacts per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 3 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.

supervisions.notes:
WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES.
MAY ALSO SERVE ON ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
